subject: IpmbSensor : Add PollRate property.
commitMessage:
IpmbSensor : Add PollRate property.

In existing IpmbSensor code, pollrate value is fixed as 1 sec.

We have OCP YosemiteV2 target which has 4 removable host, each host
has 70(x4) sensors. More number of sensor will leads to CPU usage.

Also IPMB Version does not require to read the version for every second.

Therefore, pollRate property can be added in the EM file and based on
those values each sensor/version can be read and updated. Hence CPU
utilization also reduces.

CPU load - pollRate is 1 sec.
PID  PPID  USER  STAT  VSZ   %VSZ  %CPU     COMMAND
323   1    root   R    8200   2%    16%  /usr/bin/ipmbsensor

CPU load - pollRate is 5 sec.
PID  PPID  USER  STAT  VSZ   %VSZ  %CPU     COMMAND
294   1    root   S    8124   2%    6%   /usr/bin/ipmbsensor

TESTED: Tested in yosemitev2 by giving different PollRate
to each sensor and verified.

Signed-off-by: Jayashree Dhanapal <jayashree-d@hcl.com>
Change-Id: I1f80d426699b11a1ac8c33137d12319df429620e

Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 9f6d4fd6fad9a8d74e348317a13ee3c75e01b757 by Ed Tanous

Please wrap your commits 50/72.

Also, some more details as to why (Don't have to be extensive) this is desired for IPMB, and why there aren't better options available.
Done
Does not appear done.  Your new commit message doesn't answer "why" this change is needed.  What use case are you trying to fulfill?

In existing IpmbSensor code, pollrate value is fixed as 1 sec. If the pollRate value is 1 sec, it will increase the frequency of reading sensor value and also increases CPU utilization.

To reduce CPU usage, pollrate property is added.

Some real data would be helpful, what cpu load do you see when it is polling at 1second. What kind of polling rate do you plan to use and how does it affect the cpu load? Any analysis done on impact for fan control?

IPMB sensor is only for monitoring, there is no impact for fan sensor. Already, I have submitted patch for SDR sensor, where it will have around 70 sensors and it occupies more CPU usage.

Regarding the cpu load, the below value is taken when pollrate is 1 sec.
PID  PPID  USER  STAT  VSZ   %VSZ  %CPU     COMMAND
323   1    root   R    8200   2%    16%  /usr/bin/ipmbsensor

We are using pollRate around 120 sec, to update the sensor values.

Hmm, I am surprised to see 16%, my system uses 1%. How many sensors do you have? When using 120 sec, what is the CPU load? I am wondering whether there is something else going is your CPU loading. on.

Currently, we have OCP YosemiteV2 target which has 4 removable host, each host has 70(x4) sensors. Based on the requirement, we can also change the pollrate to each sensor.

Also, IPMB version patch is submitted in gerrit, it does not require to read the version for every second. Therefore, pollrate property is suggested in IPMB.
Thanks for explaining with details. It makes sense to me now. Please add the number of sensors with the CPU load data. Also cpu load with reduced poll frequency.
Done

recommend use variable names consistent with other sensor services.
example:
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/38446
Done

nit: please take a look at existing code and follow the same naming convention 
https://github.com/openbmc/dbus-sensors/blob/master/include/HwmonTempSensor.hpp#L33
Done

I would get rid off this because "increase" does not make sense here. IMO
Maybe just show your use case and state the need to tune it down.
Done
any reason this needs to be in Seconds instead of MSec? example: https://github.com/openbmc/dbus-sensors/blob/12e3d67e3ba76bc832e2e1e1fc38933b055afd79/include/HwmonTempSensor.hpp#L33

Already pollrate Value was declared as Seconds in ipmbsensor.cpp. So I have used as it is. 
https://github.com/openbmc/dbus-sensors/blob/master/src/IpmbSensor.cpp#L343
Could you please let me know if you want to have it in Msec ?
I prefer using MSec to be consistent with other services. But I will defer it to Ed to make a final call
+1. What if there is a need to change the pollrate to some MSec ?
I will change to MSec and submit the patch.
Suggest to use unit8_t for consistency.
I am reading firmware version with polling rate of 10 mins, so that I have used int for that variable.
Ack
Same here, Suggest to use unit8_t for consistency.
I am reading firmware version with polling rate of 10 mins, so that I have used int for that variable.
Ack
This should be float if keep second as unit, o.w. it does not make sense to have member variable in MSec. Please try to look at existing code (other sensors) and try to be consistent when possible.
Done
update this to float also: static constexpr float pollRateDefault
Thanks for pointing it out, Updated the changes.
Please handle the cases, if pollRate value is less than 0.
Thanks, Updated the changes.
